TITLE: Chinese intelligence officers charged with obstructing Huawei prosecution as DOJ reveals 2 more cases of China interference
SUMMARY: Attorney General Merrick Garland detailed three criminal cases involving efforts by China in the United States.

TITLE: Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas temporarily blocks Sen. Graham's subpoena from Georgia grand jury
SUMMARY: A Georgia grand jury investigating possible criminal interference in the 2020 election by Donald Trump and his allies had subpoeaned Sen. Lindsey Graham.

TITLE: Republican gains in key states signal bad news for Democrats ahead of midterms, new polls show
SUMMARY: In Ohio, more likely voters said they would rather have Republicans in charge of Congress than Democrats, according to a Spectrum News/Siena College poll.

SUMMARY: Polls released by Spectrum News/Siena College and Marist both found Vance and Ryan even among likely Ohio voters in the key U.S. Senate race.

SUMMARY: As Schmidt wielded enormous influence over the future of U.S. AI policy, he also positioned himself to profit personally from the most promising start-ups.

TITLE: Supreme Court Justice Samuel Alito told Ted Kennedy the legal basis ensuring abortion rights was 'settled' law in 2005, new book reveals
SUMMARY: Supreme Court Justice Samuel Alito wrote the majority decision in the case that overturned Roe v. Wade, which had established a right to abortion.

TITLE: Russian court will hear Brittney Griner's appeal Tuesday as WNBA star tries to trim 9-year sentence
SUMMARY: Griner was arrested in February after Russian authorities found vape canisters containing cannabis oil in her luggage.

TITLE: Fake billionaire, Harvard MBA grad Justin Costello denied bail after judge calls him 'economic danger' to public
SUMMARY: Justin Costello posed as a billionaire, Harvard MBA, and Special Forces Iraq veteran to pull off a big securities fraud, prosecutors charge.

SUMMARY: The GOP investment in the Pennsylvania Senate race came before John Fetterman and Trump-backed Dr. Oz were set to face off in their one and only debate.

TITLE: Walmart, Disney among top 12 employers that laid off thousands during the pandemic, House inquiry finds
SUMMARY: A survey by the House Select Subcommittee on the Coronavirus Crisis found the nation's largest employers laid off thousands between 2019 and 2021.

SUMMARY: Arizona Republican gubernatorial candidate Kari Lake is seeing an uptick in support from corporate leaders as she pushes false election conspiracies.

SUMMARY: Griner was arrested in February after Russian authorities found vape canisters containing cannabis oil in her luggage.

SUMMARY: Justin Costello posed as a billionaire, Harvard MBA and an Iraq War veteran to pull off a big securities fraud, prosecutors charge.

SUMMARY: Pennsylvania Senate Democratic hopeful John Fetterman and his Republican rival Dr. Mehmet Oz came out of the gate swinging in their only debate.

SUMMARY: The debate put a spotlight on Fetterman's continued struggles after a life-threatening stroke in May took him off the campaign trail for months.

SUMMARY: The leaders of Germany and France are meeting Wednesday in Paris, but this encounter almost got cancelled as tensions between both sides grow.

SUMMARY: Biden cited processing fees for concert tickets, resort fees at hotels, credit card late fees, airline fees and termination charges for cable or internet plans.

SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump has refused for years to publicly release his income tax returns. A House committee could soon get them.

SUMMARY: Sen. Elizabeth Warren, D-Mass., blasted peer-to-peer payment platform Zelle in a letter to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.

SUMMARY: White House chief of staff Ron Klain received a warning from the Office of Special Counsel for violating the Hatch Act with a retweet of a political post.

SUMMARY: Amazon donated $400,000 to a conservative nonprofit group that's pushed back on antitrust legislation. It tied for the second-highest listed donor contribution.

SUMMARY: Cheney is backing Slotkin in the Wyoming Republican's first-ever endorsement of a Democrat after having lost her GOP primary race to a Trump pick.

SUMMARY: U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission Chair Gary Gensler defended the agency's implementation of the clawback rule as a straightforward directive by Congress.

SUMMARY: Paul Pelosi, the husband of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, was brutally attacked by David DePape in his San Francisco home, police say.

SUMMARY: The House Ways and Means Committee for years has tried to get income tax returns of former President Donald Trump.

SUMMARY: Conventional wisdom says Republicans have the upper hand on the economy, but New Dems are quickly dispelling that myth.

SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump has endorsed Herschel Walker, Dr. Mehmet Oz, Adam Laxalt and Blake Masters in the four key midterm election Senate races.

SUMMARY: The leftist leader's presidency means "a return to policies to save the Amazon," as he pledges to cut deforestation to zero and set new emissions targets.

SUMMARY: A conservative majority on the Supreme Court is expected to be open to the idea of ending the use of race, or affirmative action, in college admissions.

TITLE: Biden threatens higher taxes on oil companies if they do not work to lower gas prices

SUMMARY: Twenty-six percent of respondents said they "approve somewhat" of Biden's performance and an additional 22% neither approve or disapprove.

SUMMARY: The House Ways and Means Committee has sought federal income tax returns of Donald Trump from the IRS. The Supreme Court could now hear an appeal of the case.

SUMMARY: Prosecutors have accused DePape of breaking into the San Francisco residence of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and violently assaulting Paul Pelosi with a hammer.

SUMMARY: U.S. banks report suspicious transactions, including payments for possible ransomware attacks, to federal authorities under the Bank Secrecy Act.

SUMMARY: The Georgia grand jury is investigating possible criminal meddling in the 2020 election by Donald Trump and his allies. President Joe Biden won the state.

SUMMARY: Vice President Kamala Harris plans to announce the new initiative while visiting a sheet metal workers' training facility and union hall in Boston on Wednesday.

SUMMARY: Justin Costello was indicted for duping investors out of millions in schemes where he claimed to be billionaire, a Harvard MBA and an Iraq war veteran.

SUMMARY: Disney and its CEO Bob Chapek are preparing for Republicans to possibly become the majority in Congress.

SUMMARY: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk was pressed by civil rights leaders to keep banned users off the site and maintain election integrity tools.

SUMMARY: Olena Zelenska on Wednesday called on Western leaders to offer more military support to Ukraine as Russia's onslaught extends into the winter months.

SUMMARY: President Joe Biden urged Americans to reject election-denying candidates and be patient with results ahead of the first national Election Day held since the Jan. 6 attack.

SUMMARY: An increasing number of Americans are expressing frustrations with the two main political parties and see a third party as a potential solution.

SUMMARY: Spending in federal and state races in the 2022 elections is expected to top $16.7 billion, making them the most expensive midterms ever.

SUMMARY: The man accused of attacking House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's husband could be deported from the U.S. after he is released from custody, DHS said.

SUMMARY: Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo backs the Biden administrations new rules against allowing U.S. companies and citizens to support China's chip manufacturing industry.

SUMMARY: The Black Sea Grain Initiative, which is set to expire next month, has helped address the mounting food crisis triggered in part by Russia's war.

SUMMARY: Oz, a Republican backed by Trump, grew into a TV celebrity largely through his appearances on The Oprah Winfrey Show.

SUMMARY: The Supreme Court on Friday rejected a second request to block the Biden administration's student loan debt relief program.

SUMMARY: President Joe Biden and former President Barack Obama will appear on the campaign trail together Saturday for the first time since Biden took office.

SUMMARY: "We are deeply concerned about the safety of individuals who are exercising their constitutional right to vote," Arizona election officials said.
